result.execSummary:
The defendant Marlene M Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant has 24 hours to report due to late hearing time.

miscConds.notes: Follow any counseling recommended by agent

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marlene M Taylor

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marlene M Taylor in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. D.A. had pre-trial & Agreed to not file additional charges. Based on plea will recommend: Sentence withheld 18 mo probation. $243.00 plus dom surcharge. Defendant completed Waiver of Right to Atty.  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty. 
Court finds defendant guilty. Withheld sentence, 18 month probation. $243.00 costs plus $100.00 domestic abuse surcharge. Follow any counseling recommended by agent. 24 hours to report to probation.

Defendant Marlene M Taylor in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.    Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking today

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Court questions the defendant.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.  Court accepts defendant's waiver of Attorney.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return and pre-trial.  Return date scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
